com.google.android.filament

类 View.TemporalAntiAliasingOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.android.filament.View.TemporalAntiAliasingOptions
  • 封闭类:
    View

    public static class View.TemporalAntiAliasingOptions
extends java.lang.Object
    Options for Temporal Anti-aliasing (TAA) Most TAA parameters are extremely costly to change, as they will trigger the TAA post-process shaders to be recompiled. These options should be changed or set during initialization. `filterWidth`, `feedback` and `jitterPattern`, however, can be changed at any time. `feedback` of 0.1 effectively accumulates a maximum of 19 samples in steady state. see "A Survey of Temporal Antialiasing Techniques" by Lei Yang and all for more information.
    另请参阅:
    setTemporalAntiAliasingOptions()

    • 字段概要

      字段 
      限定符和类型 字段和说明
      View.TemporalAntiAliasingOptions.BoxClipping boxClipping
      clipping algorithm
      View.TemporalAntiAliasingOptions.BoxType boxType
      type of color gamut box
      boolean enabled
      enables or disables temporal anti-aliasing
      float feedback
      history feedback, between 0 (maximum temporal AA) and 1 (no temporal AA).
      boolean filterHistory
      whether to filter the history buffer
      boolean filterInput
      whether to apply the reconstruction filter to the input
      float filterWidth
      reconstruction filter width typically between 0.2 (sharper, aliased) and 1.5 (smoother)
      boolean historyReprojection
      whether to apply history reprojection (debug option)
      View.TemporalAntiAliasingOptions.JitterPattern jitterPattern 
      float lodBias
      texturing lod bias (typically -1 or -2)
      boolean preventFlickering
      adjust the feedback dynamically to reduce flickering
      float sharpness
      post-TAA sharpen, especially useful when upscaling is true.
      boolean upscaling
      4x TAA upscaling.
      boolean useYCoCg
      whether to use the YcoCg color-space for history rejection
      float varianceGamma

        public float filterWidth
        reconstruction filter width typically between 0.2 (sharper, aliased) and 1.5 (smoother)
